column9: Lifetime: The number of people who had your Page's post enter their screen. Posts include statuses, photos, links, videos and more. (Unique Users)
column10: Lifetime: The number of people who had your Page's post enter their screen through unpaid distribution. (Unique Users)
column11: Lifetime: The number of people who had your Page's post enter their screen through paid distribution such as an ad. (Unique Users)
column12: Lifetime: The number of times your Page's post entered a person's screen. Posts include statuses, photos, links, videos and more. (Total Count)
column13: Lifetime: The number of times your Page's posts entered a person's screen through unpaid distribution. (Total Count)
column14: Lifetime: The number of times your Page's post entered a person's screen through paid distribution such as an ad. (Total Count)
column15: Lifetime: The number of unique people who engaged in certain ways with your Page post, for example by commenting on, liking, sharing, or clicking upon particular elements of the post. (Unique Users)
column16: Lifetime: The number of people who matched the audience targeting that clicked anywhere in your post on News Feed. (Unique Users)
column17: Lifetime: The number of clicks anywhere in your post on News Feed from the user that matched the audience targeting on it. (Total Count)
column18: Lifetime: The number of people who have given negative feedback to your post. (Unique Users)
column19: Lifetime: The number of times people have given negative feedback to your post. (Total Count)
column20: Lifetime: The number of impressions of your Page post to people who have liked your Page. (Total Count)
column21: Lifetime: The number of people who saw your Page post because they've liked your Page (Unique Users)
column22: Lifetime: The number of paid impressions of your Page post to people who have liked your Page. (Total Count)
column23: Lifetime: The number of people who like your Page and who saw your Page post in an ad or sponsored story. (Unique Users)
column24: Lifetime: The number of people who have liked your Page and clicked anywhere in your posts. (Unique Users)
column25: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed to 95% of its length without any paid promotion. (Unique Users)
column26: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed to 95% of its length without any paid promotion. (Total Count)
column27: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed to 95% of its length after paid promotion. (Unique Users)
column28: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed to 95% of its length after paid promotion. (Total Count)
column29: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed for more than 3 seconds without any paid promotion. (Unique Users)
column30: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed for more than 3 seconds without any paid promotion. (Total Count)
column31: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed more than 3 seconds after paid promotion. (Unique Users)
column32: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed more than 3 seconds after paid promotion. (Total Count)
column33: Lifetime: Average time video viewed (Total Count)
column34: Lifetime: Length of a video post (Total Count)
column35: Lifetime: The number of unique people who created a story about your Page post by interacting with it. (Unique Users)
column38: Lifetime: The number of stories created about your Page post, by action type. (Total Count)
column41: Lifetime: The number of people who matched the audience targeting on the post that clicked anywhere in the post on News Feed, by type. (Unique Users)
column45: Lifetime: The number of clicks anywhere in the post on News Feed from users that matched the audience targeting on the post, by type. (Total Count)
column49: Lifetime: The number of times people have given negative feedback to your post, by type. (Total Count)
column51: Lifetime: The number of people who have given negative feedback to your post, by type. (Unique Users)

column3: Check out Bambi Banks-Couleé on the COVER of RedEye! Her starring role in #KingsandQueens premieres tomorrow! #pride
Kissing Walls is coming soon to OTV! Check out the trailer exclusively on Paper Magazine and behold the beautiful work Zak Payne put into season 2!

Throw some coins to  Reunion Chicago, one of the only sliding-scale venues and project incubators in Chicago prioritized for LGBTQ+ and communities of color. Reunion has been integral to OTV - Open Television's growth over the years and we can't wait to keep building with this dream manifested by our day-one staff, Eli Micky and Associate Board Member, Kristen Kaza! Any and every donation makes a difference!

Happy 🌈pride🌈 family! This #pridemonth consider going #beyondboystown and supporting Reunion Chicago! This space has been integral to the growth of OTV. In our Reunion residency, our team members hold office hours, have screenings, host workshops, shared countless hugs, and many a well earned disco nap. 

Reunion is one of Chicago’s only sliding scale venues and project incubators prioritized for and run by LGBTQ+ folk and communities of color. It’s managed by our girl, Head of Marketing, Eli Micky and OTV fam and board member Kristen Kaza (happy birthday!!!) Supporting Reunion is supporting OTV and our community.

Donate to their gofundme and learn more about the ways you can support: https://www.gofundme.com/reunionchi

Photos by Paul Octavious for the Family Faces of Reunion series

The Kings and Queens Pilot online release is in one week, the same day as Chicago Is A Drag Fest w Raja, Tiffany Pollard, TS Madison &more !

In the pilot by Rachel Relman , drag performers and best friends Polly Glamory (Bambi Banks-Couleé ) and Stevie Stars (Amber Thomas) ditch their boring college graduation to compete in the last round of a drag competition. Their relationships with each other and everyone around them are tested as they try to become the best performers in the most competitive drag scene in the country.

Look out for the release on weareo.tv

Kings and Queens is an independent comedy pilot created, written and directed by Chicago comedian Rachel Relman. Drag performers Polly Glamory and Stevie Stars ditch their boring college graduation to make it to the last round of a drag competition on time so they can compete for the title of the best Drag Queen and King in Boystown. With performances from some of Chicago's real top drag performers, Kings and Queens is a story about what it means to be a young queer artist in one of the most competitive drag markets in the world.

Pilot written and directed by Rachel Relman.

We are thrilled to finally announce that thanks to the Pop Culture Collaborative (c/o Rockefeller Philanthropy Advisors) we are funding artists to write new, longer form TV/film projects for the very first time! 

We selected four artists who have projects on OTV and are at an inflection point in their careers to develop their short projects into more ambitious stories! Stephanie Jeter, our head of production, is running the program with Britt Julious, who is our first artist manager.

Thank you Northwestern for helping us make this announcement!

“It was a cold night in January and Kyra and I were gonna go to the club but it was like, minus 20 windchill so, instead, we sat on the couch and started swiping through Bumble. We just kind of noticed that all of the men on these dating apps were either underselling themselves or were actively offensive.” 

The story of The Right Swipe in These Days!
Damaged Goods is queer AF!

#FreakyPhyllis is now streaming on weareo.tv ! 

Find out what happens when grandma goes bad in this hilarious series by Arnetta Randall.

We're thrilled to announce that thanks to a grant from the Surdna Foundation with support from The Field Foundation of Illinois/MacArthur Foundation we are FUNDED for a 5th cycle in 2020! 

We'll be back with new shows soon but in the meantime binge our 62 programs, 22 of them released in 2019, at http://weareo.tv!

Extra special thanks to Threewalls for acting as our fiscal sponsor as we are still a new non-profit :)

"This is an intersectional feminist story, and it was crucial that women of color led the process. Diversity is when the most privileged people give marginalized folks a seat at the table. Equity is when those marginalized folks are actually running the show." - Juli Del Prete

Learn more about The Right Swipe thanks to The Light Leaks!

Just Call Me Ripley is a coming out story where nobody cries! This comedic web series centers on Ripley who’s group of diverse, queer, wacky friends will support her no matter what she decides about her sexuality - but that doesn’t always make things easier... (Ok maybe there’s a little crying).

The series is created by Shannon Noll and is #nowstreaming at https://www.weareo.tv/originals/justcallmeripley
"I’m shouting from the rooftops about the rest of the Cycle 4 OTV Season, because there’s so much to love." - Mia McCullough does a fantastic overview of our 2019 slate!

In Night Night, a series by Nyne Blackmon, a recovering alcoholic gets blackmailed into contract killing to save his family from scandal, shaking his hold over his sobriety and his life in general.

You can stream #NightNightseries now are weareo.tv/originals/nightnight

Conspiracy Theorist Webseries premieres Wednesday, June 12 at 7pm CST! Join our watch party live or join us in person at Reunion Chicago.

In Conspiracy Theorist Webseries, Renee Hawthorne is a third year doctoral candidate enrolled in a top ranked (neuro)psychology program when her life is derailed by a psychotic breakdown.

The series is created by Rebba Amaris and directed by Kelechi Agwuncha.

Conspiracy Theorist Webseries premieres Wednesday, June 12 at 7pm CST! Join our watch party live or join us in person at Reunion Chicago. 

In Conspiracy Theorist, Renee Hawthorne is a third year doctoral candidate enrolled in a top ranked (neuro)psychology program when her life is derailed by a psychotic breakdown.

The series is created by Rebba Amaris and directed by Kelechi Agwuncha.

“I started the project to solve this issue: Why, if we can watch an artist’s work online from anywhere, does an artist have to go to LA to work in television?” said Aymar Jean Christian, OTV founder and assistant professor of communication studies at Northwestern University."

Thank you The Field Foundation of Illinois for awarding us this amazing $50,000 grant!

We're celebrating the end of a cycle with an evening chock full of programming! Tonight we have the premiere of Kissing Walls, Yogma season 2, Conspiracy Theorist Webseries, and Aliens in America. 

As always, this event is completely free. We will also have a donations based bar with beer and wine and some snacks. See you in an hour and don't forget to RSVP!

Created by Rebba Amaris and directed by Kelechi Agwuncha. 

Renee Hawthorne is a third year doctoral candidate enrolled in a top ranked (neuro)psychology program when her life is derailed by a psychotic breakdown.

Just Call Me Ripley is LIVE! Enjoy this joyful coming out story 🌨☁️🌈🌤☀️✨

https://www.weareo.tv/originals/justcallmeripley

In #NightNight created by Nyne Blackmon, a recovering alcoholic gets blackmailed into contract killing to save his family from scandal, shaking his hold over his sobriety and his life in general.

It premieres tomorrow at 7pm CST on weareo.tv. Join us at the premiere party at Reunion Chicago tomorrow.
Head out to The Doc Talk Show tomorrow (Sunday) to see and meet Sarah Minnie, the fantastic co-producer of the The Right Swipe!
